documents.text:
--- Visit 1 | Date: 2025-06-21 ---

Routine protocol visit 1. Patient ID: SA-P001.

Vital signs obtained: blood pressure 128/67, heart rate 77, weight 74.8 kg.

Liver enzymes elevated — classified as Grade 2 hepatotoxicity. Detected on day 18 labs. Currently ongoing. Treatment was held pending resolution. Dose interruption documented.
Adverse event noted: Rash — mild (CTCAE Grade 1). Onset day 19. Resolved by day 27. Assessed as probable to study drug. No dose modification required.

Labs drawn today:
  - PSA: 10.18 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 4.23 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0] (LOW)
  - AST: 13.15 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 14.12 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 2.25 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0] (LOW)
  - Creatinine: 0.99 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Assessment: Tolerating therapy. Plan to continue protocol. Next visit in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 2 | Date: 2025-07-12 ---

Follow-up visit #2 for patient SA-P001.

Vitals: BP 140/83 mmHg, HR 72 bpm, Weight 77.9 kg.

Lab panel results from today's draw:
  - PSA: 10.67 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 4.5 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0] (LOW)
  - AST: 10.29 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 13.73 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 2.22 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0] (LOW)
  - Creatinine: 1.04 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Imaging: Target lesion measurements stable — neither sufficient shrinkage for PR nor increase for PD. Classified as stable disease (SD) per RECIST.

Serum PSA: 8.07 ng/mL, representing a increase of 17.6% compared to baseline.

Assessment: Tolerating therapy. Plan to continue protocol. Next visit in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 3 | Date: 2025-08-02 ---

Routine protocol visit 3. Patient ID: SA-P001.

Vital signs obtained: blood pressure 119/72, heart rate 76, weight 93.7 kg.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Labs drawn today:
  - PSA: 10.68 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 5.16 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0] (LOW)
  - AST: 16.61 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 13.43 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 1.95 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0] (LOW)
  - Creatinine: 1.01 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Plan: Continue current dose. Return for cycle 4 in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 4 | Date: 2025-08-23 ---

Visit 4 clinical encounter for SA-P001.

VS: 157/83 | HR 71 | Wt 67.6 kg. Patient well-nourished and in no acute distress.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Laboratory results:
  - PSA: 10.92 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 8.2 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 14.87 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 13.33 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 2.26 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0] (LOW)
  - Creatinine: 1.01 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

CT restaging shows partial response. Target lesions reduced significantly (47.7% decrease from baseline). No new lesions identified. RECIST: PR.

PSA now 3.59 ng/mL — decrease 47.7% from initial value.

Plan: Continue current regimen. Follow up in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 5 | Date: 2025-09-13 ---

SA-P001 — Cycle 5, Day 1 visit.

Vitals: BP 143/80 mmHg, HR 78 bpm, Weight 81.0 kg.

Patient reports Elevated ALT (mild, Grade 1). First noted day 98. Currently ongoing. No dose modification required.

Blood work results:
  - PSA: 9.55 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 9.32 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 15.53 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 13.61 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 1.35 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0] (LOW)
  - Creatinine: 0.97 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Assessment: Tolerating therapy. Plan to continue protocol. Next visit in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 6 | Date: 2025-10-04 ---

Patient SA-P001 presents for scheduled cycle 6 visit.

Vital signs obtained: blood pressure 108/71, heart rate 72, weight 63.2 kg.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Labs drawn today:
  - PSA: 9.57 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 5.8 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0] (LOW)
  - AST: 15.05 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 13.09 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 1.52 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0] (LOW)
  - Creatinine: 1.07 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Restaging CT demonstrates complete disappearance of all target lesions. No new lesions. RECIST assessment: Complete Response (CR).

PSA now 2.42 ng/mL — decrease 64.7% from initial value.

Assessment: Tolerating therapy. Plan to continue protocol. Next visit in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 7 | Date: 2025-10-25 ---

Patient SA-P001 presents for scheduled cycle 7 visit.

Vitals: BP 116/91 mmHg, HR 81 bpm, Weight 63.4 kg.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Lab panel results from today's draw:
  - PSA: 8.95 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 8.41 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 13.08 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 13.14 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 1.01 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0] (LOW)
  - Creatinine: 1.05 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Plan: Continue current regimen. Follow up in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 8 | Date: 2025-11-15 ---

Patient did not present for scheduled visit 8. Attempted phone contact — voicemail left.

Patient removed from study protocol following confirmed disease progression on latest imaging. Referred to alternate treatment pathway.
